quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go. Get the door.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here we are.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go. Push!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Push!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, turn it around.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really shove it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You'll break it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shove it through! Break it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You shove it. Shove it back! Here we go. Don't break the branches, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I got a splinter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, suck it up. We all have problems. Hey, everybody, look what we have! [laughs] Nice, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I've got it leveraged. Push. Straight up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: On three. Ready? Big, one, two, three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: One, two, three. [they push the tree up and it breaks through a ceiling tile.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Merry Christmas!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Did it work?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [holds up the piece of tree he just cut off with a paper cutter] Well, sort of. Why did you get it so big?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A, that's what she said, and B, I wanted it to be impressive. The biggest day of the year deserves the biggest tree of the year.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: But what are we going to do with this hacked off part?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, that is a perfectly good mini-tree, Kevin. And we are going to sell that to charity. That's what Christmas is all about.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So this year, for the first time ever, I got Pam in Secret Santa. And I got her this teapot, which I know she really wants, so she can make tea at her desk. But I'm also going to stuff it with some inside jokes. Like, this is my high school yearbook photo. She saw it at the party, and it really makes her laugh. Not sure why. What else .. ooh. This is a hot sauce packet. She put this on a hot dog a couple years ago because she thought it was ketchup. And it was really funny, so I kept the other two. [holds up a miniature pencil] This would take a little too long to explain, so I won't. And this is the card. Because Christmas is the time to tell people how you feel.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Is there anything we're missing? Phyllis, you got the lights?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yes, I got those cute little ones. [Angela looks at her disapprovingly] Do you think I should have gotten the big ones?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: We'll see.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Angela drafted me into the party planning committee. Her memo said that we need to prepare for every possible disaster. Which to me seems excessive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [comes into the conference room in a Santa hat and beard]  Merry Christmas! Ho, ho, ho, [points to Ryan] pimp. I'm kidding. What do we got, what do we got? How many plates are we getting?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Fifty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Double it. Double everything. Double ice cream. Double napkins. Double it. On me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It was a tough year. I had to fire somebody this year. This party has to really rock. Check it out. Christmas bonus. 3,000 G's. I got this for helping save the company money. So I guess some good came out of firing Devon after all. Maybe I should call him and tell him that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want people to cut loose. I want people making out in closets. I want people hanging from the ceilings, lamp shades on the heads. I want it to be a Playboy Mansion party. And also, I want you to spread the word that I will have my digital camera. And I'll be taking pictures all along the way. And the best and craziest thing that happens will be on the cover of the newsletter. Incentive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You do realize that we can't serve liquor at the party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, I know. Damn it. Stupid corporate wet blankets. Like booze ever killed anybody.

quotes.speaker: Kevin & Oscar
quotes.line: One, two, three. [they lift and start to move a desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You guys should use a hand truck.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Do we have one?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [having trouble with a plastic tablecloth as Pam stands idly by] Will you help me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No! No way! It... no.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Come on, Mike, let me borrow the hat for just a couple of hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You wanna be Santa?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Have you ever seen Santa?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, I've seen Santa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Who cares?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I'm sorry. It just doesn't work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael, I would like to be the elf.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That makes sense because he has elfish features.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [now wearing an elf hat and ears] Okay, everybody listen up! It is time to get your presents, wrap them, and place them under the tree like so. If you do not get your present wrapped and under the tree within the next five minutes you will be disqualified from Secret Santa. All right? No exceptions except Michael.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I got Angela. She is into these posters of babies dressed as adults. I got her one of those. I felt kind of weird buying that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I got Creed. And to tell you the truth, I don't know anything about Creed. I know his name's Creed. I know he works right over there. I think he's Irish and I .. I got him this shamrock keychain.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I got myself for Secret Santa. I was supposed to tell somebody, but I didn't [smiles happily].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You get something good this year?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think I did a pretty good job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah? Who did you have?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, I can't tell you cause it's a secret.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think I got something pretty nice for my guy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I spent a lot of dough. Lot of dough. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, there's a $20 limit, right? So .. ?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. I wanted this party to be really special so I sorta went above and beyond.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's great. Well don't tell me who it is, cause I can ..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It was Ryan. Yeah. I have Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Gather round. Secret Santa, let's go. Let's go. Come on. Stanley, no, I'm going to handle the cord. Okay, safety reasons.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I know how to plug something in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I want to do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, let's count it down, like Rockefeller Center. Ready?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Three, two, one. [very dim lights come on the tree]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not great.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I'm sorry, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think the tree looks nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, I could get some flares from my car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no. Shake it off, everybody. Just, let's do Secret Santa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Presents are the best way to show someone how much you care. It's like this tangible thing that you can point to and say, "Hey, man, I love you this many dollars worth."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: First present, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [rips off the wrapping] Shower radio. Neat.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, good, that was from me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Thanks, Kelly. You know I was gonna get one of ..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. Okay. That's enough. Let's keep it moving on. Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, cool. [opens his plastic bag]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: That's from me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Great. Where did you get it?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I don't know. It was so long ago.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: He obviously forgot to get me something, and then he went in his closet and dug out this little number [holds up way-too-short sleeves] and then threw it in a bag.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Yep. That's exactly what happened.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [opens up her present] Oh, my god! Thank you very much, Santa, whoever you are. It's awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There's a little more to it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right, next. Ryan. [tosses present]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, don't!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [unwraps present] Whoa, a video iPod.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whoa. Wow. Jeez. Somebody really got carried away with the spirit of Christmas. That was me, I got a little carried away.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Wasn't there a $20 limit on the gift? This is 400 bucks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You don't know that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, you left the price tag on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I did?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What? Oh, shoot. Wow. Okay, well, who cares? It doesn't matter what I spent. What matters is that Christmas is fun, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh hey, for me. What is in here? [opens a handmade oven mitt] Oh, come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I knitted it for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: An oven mitt? Okay. [walks out]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So Phyllis is basically saying, "Hey Michael, I know you did a lot to help the office this year but I only care about you a homemade oven mitt's worth." I gave Ryan an iPod.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Should we just keep opening up the presents?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We don't do anything until Michael gives us further instructions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I got it! We are going to turn Secret Santa into Yankee Swap.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What is Yankee Swap?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: One person chooses a gift. The next person can either choose a gift or steal that person's gift. If your gift gets stolen, then you can steal somebody else's gift or choose a new gift.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I thought that was called Nasty Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, we call it White Elephant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I call it fun!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Why are we doing this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because it's better. Because it's more special.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It sounds mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shut it. No, it's not. Okay, just give it a shot.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael should have asked the party planning committee first. He's not supposed to just spring things on us out of nowhere. [starts to cry]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, Meredith is up first. Here's the deal. You can either pick a new gift or you can steal somebody else's gift that they've already gotten, like the oven mitt.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I'll take the teapot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, shouldn't we ... I bought that specifically for Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yankee Swap! That's what makes it fun. Pam, you can steal the oven mitt now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'll take the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: And I have to give it to her? I don't have a choice?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, now you can steal the oven mitt, the old shirt or the shower radio or pick a new gift.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [after Ryan opens a new gift - a nameplate saying 'Kelly'] That was meant for Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, I figured.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think this is going great.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [unwrapping the poster] Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, it's for Angela, so ..

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: That's like, the creepiest thing that I've ever seen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Angela, you're up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'll take the poster. Some people like these.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I will steal the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everyone wants the iPod. It's a huge hit. It is almost a Christmas miracle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, well, Oscar, you little gourmand, you have the next turn.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'll take the ... teapot.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, moving along. Meredith, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I really want the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's already been stolen this round. Pick something else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [holding oven mitt] I hope nobody takes this baby, cause this is great. Wow, look at that fine craftsmanship. Somebody really put a lot of work into that. It's beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I'll take the oven mitt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sucker! See, I wanted somebody to take it. Boom! Reverse psychology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Reverse psychology is an awesome tool. I don't know if you guys know about it, but basically you make someone think the opposite of what you believe and that tricks them into doing something stupid. Works like a charm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [opens present] "In addition to these paintball pellets, your gift includes two paintball lessons with Dwight Schrute."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You and me, Michael. Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who wants to take paintball lessons? How is that better than an iPod?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I never said it was better than an iPod.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael keeps bragging about his iPod, but you know what? Two paintball lessons with someone as experienced as I am is worth easily, like, 2 grand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [shooting paintball gun at target] Take that, Saddam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Last gift. Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I want the foot bath.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That's the thing I bought myself. I'm really psyched to use it. [pauses] Maybe I should have taken the iPod. Oh, shoot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam, steal something or pick the final gift.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I want the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure you don't want the teapot?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, I mean, it's an iPod. But ..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sorry, I ..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. No. Definitely. It's ..

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Okay, well, I guess I will take that book of short stories.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes! There you go. I want the teapot. Gracias.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Got to be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yankee Swap is like Machiavelli meets ... Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [after Phyllis leaves suddenly] What is she so upset about?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Maybe because you hated her present so much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on! I think that Yankee Swap was a big hit! I think it's a success and I'm the one who ended up with Dwight's stupid paintball pellets.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, but, Michael, the point is that we all bought gifts for specific people.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: And you should have just bought a $20 gift like everyone else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I didn't. I got a big bonus because I fired Devon, and I used the money to buy something awesome. Sue me!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You got a bonus check?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How much?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It wasn't. It wasn't that much. It was $3,000.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: All right, I'm done now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Unbelievable. I do the nicest thing that anyone has ever done for these people and they freak out. Well, happy birthday, Jesus. Sorry your party's so lame.

quotes.speaker: Liquor Store Clerk
quotes.line: It comes to $166.41.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, now, you're the expert. Is this enough to get 20 people plastered?

quotes.speaker: Liquor Store Clerk
quotes.line: Fifteen bottles of vodka? Yeah, that should do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cool, cool. Box it up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I bought this teapot for Pam, and I know she really wants it. So, can I trade you for it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No trades.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Come on, it's a shamrock keychain. Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: "A real man makes his own luck." Billy Zane. Titanic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Look, it has sentimental value, Dwight. Can I buy it from you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. I want it. I'm going to use it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You don't even drink tea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: True. But I get sinus infections, and sinus infections can be cured by making your tea from green tea leaf stems ..

quotes.speaker: JIm
quotes.line: Okay ..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: .. and pouring it directly into your nose, like so. [demonstrates]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: To think that my gift for Pam will be used for that, it's a little too much to handle.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: This is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I know. It's totally going to change the way I work out.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Yeah, I was gonna get you one of these for Christmas, and now I don't have to. I'm gonna save a ton of money.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So what are you going to get me instead?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: I don't know. Probably like, a sweater or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh-oh. Looks like Santa was a little naughty.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is Christmas spirit, as in spirits, booze.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: We can drink?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: We're really not supposed to serve alcohol.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Zip it, Toby! Just .. I mean, it's a party. Come on. If I can't throw a good party for my employees, then I am a terrible boss. Who wants a drink?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Me. Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Go, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: The deal is that this is my last hurrah, cause I made a New Year's resolution that I'm not going to drink anymore. During the week.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hi guys.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Does everybody know my boyfriend, Bob Vance?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Kevin Malone.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Ryan Howard.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What line of work you in, Bob?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: I think after I lost Culpepper and T.O it was over, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, I need McMahon, Deion Branch to have big games or else I'm done.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: It's possible. I can't believe you traded Shaun Alexander, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I had to. I needed defense.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Come on! Shaun Alexander? He's the best back in the league.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It's defense.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Oh, no. That is not worth it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It is worth it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Never.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Are you kidding? You wait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Anybody making out in here? [checks hallway] Not yet, give it time. Oh, hey, Ebenezer, boink. [takes picture of Jim] Okay, how's it going in here? [takes picture of Meredith and Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: We're running low on cups. Do you want me to just run out and get some?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: There should be some ..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no. We'll find some, don't leave the party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis, Meredith, Michael, Kevin
quotes.line: One, two, three. [do a shot]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kudos to Ryan, king of the party committee.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I really did not do anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, no, no. No false modesty, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know, you don't have to answer calls during a party. Just thought you should know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughs] No, I was just checking out my present. [holds up teapot]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But ..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I traded with Dwight. Just, I figured, you know, you went to a lot of trouble and it means a lot. And also, Roy got me an iPod or was going to get me an iPod, so ..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, either way. This is an amazing gift because it comes with bonus gifts. Look inside.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [opens teapot] Oh my god! The yearbook picture!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I think I made the right choice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, my God! It's incredible. [Jim reaches and steals his card back before she can notice it] Is this the Boggle timer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I didn't think you were going to get that one. I really didn't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is so awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not bad. And if it couldn't go to Ryan, you are the guy I'd want it to go to.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: [grabbing Michael around the neck] Merry Christmas, asswipe!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No way. Oh, you're kidding me. Packer! Yes! Todd Packer, ladies and gentlemen!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: [rapping] What's up my nerds. Check it out. [points at the mistletoe stuck down his pants]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, no, no. Oh look at that. Icing on the cake.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Pacman need a drinky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, let's fix you up. Who wants to fix up .. Toby. Toby's gonna fix you up.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [listening to music through headphones] Yeahhh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Darryl. There you go. [hands him the Santa hat] You earned it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That's okay, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no. I really, really want you to have it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: All right. Thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [looking at Xeroxed butt pictures] Whose butt is that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Mine.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Oh, how did I not guess that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [coming out of his office] Lampshade on head! It's happening!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [as Jim decorates a passed out Todd Packer] Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, hello there. [Kelly leans up and kisses him] But what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You shouldn't do things like that. The man is supposed to do that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Thanks for the party, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Oh, hey. Listen up. We're going to Poor Richard's. Who's in?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael? Poor Richard's?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, that sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Christmas is awesome. First of all, you get to spend time with people you love. Secondly, you can get drunk and no one can say anything. Third, you give presents. What's better than giving presents? And fourth, getting presents. So, four things. Not bad for one day. It's really the greatest day of all time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Meredith. Heading over to Poor Richard's?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cool, cool, cool. Do you need a ride? [Meredith drops her top. Michael takes a picture] All right, let's head out. Sounds good. Do you have a coat?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Towards me.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Towards me. That's good, towards me. Towards me. Towards me, towards me. Okay, I'm good. I'm good, I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Okay, okay. [gasping]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Creed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Remember on that animated special when they taught the uh, the monster to put the star on top? That's Dwight. Dwight's the monster that we taught to put the star on top of the tree. You take his teeth out, and he could put the star on top of the tree.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Do you want me to help you with that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Phyllis and Angela and Meredith are helpers. I guess Angela's kind of... Angela's little. Phyllis and Meredith are not little. Pam is sort of a medium helper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. Christmas lights? Good. Tinsel? Good. Star? Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight is... Dwight looks like Spock to me. He always wears the ears, and I always give him grief about looking like Spock, and he hates it because he has a different pair of ears that he wears to be Spock, for some reason.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Question, Pam. Is Roy coming to the party?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, well, you didn't tell me that. Now, he will not be allowed in unless we register him on this list.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do I look like I'm kidding? [Pam shakes her head 'no'] Phyllis, stag, I assume.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I'm bringing someone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I invited someone to the party. Bob Vance. He works at Vance Refrigeration next door. That's how we met. [whispers] He's my boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Everyone, please remain calm until we receive further instructions.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Just let us open up the presents, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Absolutely... not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What separates humans from jungle beasts? The fact that we have rules. When humans give each other gifts, they do it properly and orderly. When bears give each other gifts they just rip open a fox carcass and present it to their mate. I prefer the human way.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Man, I really wanted that. I really wanted the shower radio, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, thank God you didn't steal my oven mitt. And Oscar, you little gourmand, your turn.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'll take the tea pot.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So, I guess, you really didn't want the shower radio that bad. No, I just like tea.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No, I just like tea.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don't know why Oscar didn't like the gift. I know he wanted a shower radio. I mean, I totally remember him telling me that he wanted one.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Kelly had me last year, too, and she gave me the same exact thing. I only have one shower.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oscar, paint ball pellets.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I guess I'll take the last gift. Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It was supposed to be for Meredith, 'cause she said she likes my drawings.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Thanks. I wish I could've had it. Do you wanna trade?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Like anybody would want an oven mitt. [Phyllis gets up and leaves the party]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: So, hey, you wanna trade?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yes, totally, 'cause I was just gonna throw this out anyway.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Really? You were gonna throw out a book?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [Rap music playing] [singing] The time is now, the place is here And the whole wide world is filled with cheer My name's DMC with the mike in my hand And I'm chilling and cooling just like a snow man

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [singing] So open eyes Lend us an ear We wanna say Merry Christmas and Happy New Year [Darryl whooping] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm the DJ because I really know how to heat up a party.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I do enjoy a drink now and again, but tonight, no. I am also an officer of the law and I'm unofficially on the clock. I need to stay sober and alert. Also, on a personal note, I'm not at my best when I drink.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I actually got that for you. I had you originally.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, cool. It looks really interesting. What did you end up with? [Ryan pulls Creed's old coat out of a bag] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I didn't want anything else, so I figured at least I could give it to a homeless guy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What did you end up with?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Your shower radio.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You like music at least?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I love it. I actually used to have a radio show back in the '70s.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You're kidding. What was your DJ name?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Whacky-weed Creed.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Turns out that Creed is a pretty interesting guy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You behaved very badly tonight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: See, that's what Christmas is all about to me, is when you see someone open a gift and you think, "Man, I wish I got that." I mean, that's just such a great feeling, to watch other people envying a gift that you gave to somebody else. I don't know, it's just... I don't know, just makes you kind of feel good.
